00063 void TSquare::initClass()
00064 {
00065         SO_NODE_INIT_CLASS(TSquare, TShape, "TShape");
00066 }

00068 TSquare::TSquare( )
00069 {
00070         SO_NODE_CONSTRUCTOR(TSquare);
00071         SO_NODE_ADD_FIELD(m_sideLength, (10.0));
00072 }

00075 {
00076

00078 
00079 void TSquare::generatePrimitives(SoAction *action)
00080 {
00081     SoPrimitiveVertex   pv;
00082 
00083     // Access the state from the action.
00084     SoState  *state = action->getState();
00085    
00086     // See if we have to use a texture coordinate function,
00087     // rather than generating explicit texture coordinates.
00088     SbBool useTexFunc = ( SoTextureCoordinateElement::getType(state) ==
00089                           SoTextureCoordinateElement::FUNCTION );
00090                          
00091     // If we need to generate texture coordinates with a
00092     // function, we'll need an SoGLTextureCoordinateElement.
00093     // Otherwise, we'll set up the coordinates directly.
00094     const SoTextureCoordinateElement* tce = 0;
00095     SbVec4f texCoord;  
00096     if ( useTexFunc ) tce = SoTextureCoordinateElement::getInstance(state);
00097     else 
00098     {
00099         texCoord[2] = 0.0;
00100         texCoord[3] = 1.0;
00101     }
00102 
00103     // We'll use this macro to make the code easier. It uses the
00104     // "point" variable to store the primitive vertex's point.
00105     SbVec3f  point;
00106     
00107 
00108         const int rows = 50; // Number of points per row
00109     const int columns = 50; // Number of points per column
00110     const int totalPoints = (rows)*(columns); // Total points in the grid
00111     
00112     float vertex[totalPoints][6];    
00113    
00114     int h = 0;
00115     double ui = 0;
00116         double vj = 0;
00117         
00118         double u_step = 1.0 /(double)(rows-1); // Size of the step in parameter u to go from 0 to 1 in the number of rows
00119         double v_step = 1.0 /(double)(columns-1); // Size of the step in parameter v to go from 0 to 1 in the number of columns
00120         
00121     for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++)
00122     {
00123         for ( int j = 0 ; j < columns ; j++ )
00124         {
00125                 vertex[h][0] = GetPoint3D(ui, vj).x;
00126                 vertex[h][1] = GetPoint3D(ui, vj).y;
00127                 vertex[h][2] = GetPoint3D(ui, vj).z;
00128                 vertex[h][3] = GetNormal(ui, vj)[0];
00129                 vertex[h][4] = GetNormal(ui, vj)[1];
00130                 vertex[h][5] = GetNormal(ui, vj)[2];
00131                 pv.setPoint(vertex[h][0], vertex[h][1], vertex[h][2] );
00132                 h++; //Increase h to the next point. 
00133                 vj += v_step; // Increase parameter vj to go from initial 0 to 1 at the end of the row (keep the same ui for the whole row)
00134         }
00135         vj = 0; // Re-initialize parameter vj to 0 in order to start from 0 in the next row
00136                 ui += u_step; // Increase parameter ui to go from initial 0 to 1 in the last row.
00137     }
00138 
00139         const int totalIndices  = (rows-1)*(columns-1)*4;
00140     int32_t* indices = new int32_t[totalIndices]; 
00141     int k = 0;
00142     for(int irow = 0; irow < (rows-1); irow++)
00143            for(int icolumn = 0; icolumn < (columns-1); icolumn++)
00144            {
00145                 indices[k] = irow*columns + icolumn;
00146                 indices[k+1] = indices[k] + 1;        
00147                 indices[k+3] = indices[k] + columns;        
00148                 indices[k+2] = indices[k+3] + 1;
00149     
00150                 k+=4; //Set k to the first point of the next face.
00151            }
00152            
00153     float finalvertex[totalIndices][6];
00154     for(int ivert = 0; ivert<totalIndices;ivert++)
00155     {
00156         finalvertex[ivert][0] = vertex[indices[ivert]][0];
00157         finalvertex[ivert][1] = vertex[indices[ivert]][1];
00158         finalvertex[ivert][2] = vertex[indices[ivert]][2];  
00159                 finalvertex[ivert][3] = vertex[indices[ivert]][3];
00160                 finalvertex[ivert][4] = vertex[indices[ivert]][4];
00161                 finalvertex[ivert][5] = vertex[indices[ivert]][5];
00162     }
00163     
00164 #define GEN_VERTEX(pv, x, y, z, s, t, normal)   \
00165      point.setValue( x,                         \
00166                      y,                         \
00167                      z);                        \
00168      if (useTexFunc)                            \
00169        texCoord = tce->get(point, normal);      \
00170      else {                                     \
00171        texCoord[0] = s;                         \
00172        texCoord[1] = t;                         \
00173      }                                          \
00174      pv.setPoint(point);                        \
00175      pv.setNormal(normal);                      \
00176      pv.setTextureCoords(texCoord);             \
00177      shapeVertex(&pv)
00178 
00179     
00180     float u = 1;
00181     float v = 1;  
00182         
00183         beginShape(action, QUADS );
00184     for( int i = 0; i < totalIndices; i++ )
00185     {
00186         //SbVec3f normal=GetNormal(finalvertex[i][0],finalvertex[i][1], finalvertex[i][2] );
00187         SbVec3f normal(finalvertex[i][3],finalvertex[i][4], finalvertex[i][5] );
00188         GEN_VERTEX(pv,  finalvertex[i][0], finalvertex[i][1],  finalvertex[i][2], u,  v, normal);
00189     }                   
00190     endShape();
00191 }
00192 
00193 bool TSquare::Intersect(const Ray& /*objectRay*/, double* /*tHit*/, DifferentialGeometry* /*dg*/) const 
00194 {
00195         return true;
00196 }
00197 
00198 bool TSquare::IntersectP( const Ray& objectRay ) const 
00199 {       
00200         return Intersect( objectRay, 0, 0 );
00201 }
00202 
00203 Point3D TSquare::Sample( double u, double v ) const
00204 {
00205         return GetPoint3D( u, v );
00206 }
00207 
00208 void TSquare::computeBBox(SoAction*, SbBox3f& box, SbVec3f& /*center*/ )
00209 {
00210         Point3D min = Point3D(-m_sideLength.getValue()/2,0.0, -m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00211         Point3D max = Point3D(m_sideLength.getValue()/2,0.0,m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00212         box.setBounds(SbVec3f( min.x, min.y, min.z ), SbVec3f( max.x, max.y, max.z ));
00213 }
00214 
00215 Point3D TSquare::GetPoint3D (double u, double v) const
00216 {
00217         if ((u < 0.0 && u > 1) && (v < 0.0 && v > 1))
00218         {
00219                 
00220                 tgf::SevereError("Function TSquare::GetPoint3D called with invalid parameters" );
00221         }
00222         
00223         double x = (u * m_sideLength.getValue()) - (m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00224         double z = v * m_sideLength.getValue() - (m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00225 
00226         return Point3D(x,0,z);
00227 }
00228 
00229 SbVec3f TSquare::GetNormal (double /*u*/, double /*v*/) const
00230 {
00231         return SbVec3f( 0, 1, 0);
00232 }
